title: Lacey Chabert hasn't spoken to her Mean Girls co-star Lindsay Lohan 'in forever'
text:
They were two members of tight knit high school clique 'The Plastics' in the 2004 comedy classic Mean Girls.

But Lacey Chabert has admitted she's not quite so close with co-star Lindsay Logan in real life.

'I haven't talked to her in forever,' admitted the 37-year-old actress in an interview with Fox 5 Good Day New York on Thursday.

Distance: Lacey Chabert has admitted she's not quite so close with co-star Lindsay Logan in real life

However, there doesn't appear to be any bad blood between the stars, with the Daddy Day Care actress saying of Lohan: 'I hope she's doing awesome. I know she is.'

In fact, the pair go way back, with Chabert revealing, 'We were kid actors together in New York, so I've always loved Lindsay'.

The Mississippi was also asked about the possibility of a Mean Girls reboot ever seeing the light of day, to which she replied, 'I don't know. I wish I had an answer for you.'

'I feel like you need to start a petition.'

You go Glen Coco: Lacey played Gretchen Wieners [in character on L] in the 2004 comedy classic

All good: There doesn't appear to be any bad blood between the stars, with the Daddy Day Care actress saying of Lohan [pictured in Mean Girls, L]: 'I hope she's doing awesome. I know she is. Also seen here is their co-star Amanda Seyfried [center]

As to whether she would want to be part of such a reunion, Lacey said, 'Of course I would. Gretchen is one of my favorite characters I've ever had the opportunity to play'

'I think to revisit where those women are in their lives now would be really fun.'

As for whether she ever saw any of her other co-stars from the Tina Fey-scribed movie, Chabert said, 'We talk to each other on occasion'.

'Our paths do continue to cross which is really nice'

Spearhead: Jonathan Bennett [seen here in September 2019] recently initiated an effort to reunite the cast in the name of charity

Mean Girls also featured such breakout stars as Amanda Seyfried, Rachel McAdams and Lizzy Caplan.

As for Lacey's last catch-up with the group, she said one took place on October 3rd - all in the name of charity.

'We're trying to raise money for the Thirst Project, to build a well for a village'

'Jonathan Bennett [Aaron Samuels] really spearheaded doing that'
description: Lacey Chabert has admitted she's not quite so close with Mean Girls co-star Lindsay Logan in real life, during an interview with Fox 5 Good Day New York on Thursday.
